name: Inn at Palmetto Bluff, An Auberge Resort

reviews.title: Wonderful Property
reviews.text: Seeing and experiencing The INN is enough to recommend it to everybody. It is a unique and beautiful property. The best staff ever.

reviews.title: Magical
reviews.text: The only thing that I can say negative is towars the dining options you have. A limited choice of restaurant and honestly the food was not that great and service is somewhat slow.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: I will still go back in a heart beat, it is Expensive but its all worth it!!

reviews.title: Can't wait to return
reviews.text: My family and I had a wonderful vacation at the Inn at Palmetto Bluff. The staff members were very friendly and did anything possible to make our experience pleasant. From the moment we stepped on the property, we felt the "magic" of the place. It is truly a unique experience that you wont want to miss.

reviews.title: I thought the spa was horrible
reviews.text: The tennis facility is "top-notch." The courts are beautifully groomed each morning, and towels and bottles of ice water are placed by the court for players to enjoy. I took several private lessons and a clinic during my stay. The Director of Tennis, Warren Florence, is very professional and extremely knowledgeable about the game of tennis. During the lessons, Warren reviewed the fundamentals of tennis and the different strokes. He took time to explain and demonstrate the different strokes. After the first lesson, I felt more confident on the court. He provided me with some great pointers, and I look forward to using them on the court! I highly recommend staying at the Inn at Palmetto Bluff and taking advantage of the wonderful tennis facility. I promise you will not be disappointed!

reviews.title: This Place is Wonderful
reviews.text: What a wonderful resort! The setting is idyllic, the cuisine is fabulous and the staff at the resort could not be nicer. We felt like we were inside a Norman Rockwell painting of a quaint village, enjoying life how it should be enjoyed. Everything is new, the grounds were perfect, nature was all around us and there is so much to do, we could not do it all. Their spa and golf course were in incredible shape. They even gave us each the use of a fishing pole and tackle and the use of two bicycles during our stay so that we could be young again. We even took their complimentary boat ride over to Hilton Head Island for the day, one day. We had a ball and definitely will be back. I hestitated to write this review because I did not want too many people to know about this very special place. It truly is a wonderful and peaceful. Next time, we may bring the family to enjoy this place, since it looks like a perfect place for a family too.

reviews.title: Spectacular Palmetto Bluff
reviews.text: Our stay at The Palmetto Bluff Resort was arranged as a businees gathering. We drove to Palmetto Bluff for the gathering after spending a couple of days in Charleston, SC (another great place). After our 3+ mile drive into the main area of this 20,000 acre property we were greeted by the bell staff who unloaded the bags and placed them on a large golf cart. After checking in we were driven by golf cart to our private cottage where we found a complimentary bottle of red wine and a snack. The refrigerator was fully stocked with complimentary beverages.

reviews.title: Wanted to love it more than we did
reviews.text: After delivering the bags the bell person gave a tour of the 1,3500 sq. ft. home and showed us how to use everyting in the house. Including the cd/dvd player, 36" plasma TV, shower with steam room and fireplace. The room has a screened porch over looking a small pond that is frequented by blue herron, great white egret, turtles and an alligator. It has a cushioned couch and two cushioned chairs, tables and a ceiling fan. Two bicycles were provided for our use on the bike trails.

reviews.title: Amazing Weekend
reviews.text: This is an extraordinary property that is only made better by the staff who will provide anything possible as quickly and politely as they can. They have ultimate respect for their guests. Rides to the Inn are minutes away after request.

reviews.title: Fabulous weekend getaway
reviews.text: Plenty of activitys were planned. Boat tours are available. An oyster bake on a small peninsula was fabulous. Arrival was by boat and departure was by open air bus. The food was very good. The wine list was a bit weak in the old world varietals but was very nice.

reviews.title: Southern Beauty
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend at Palmetto Bluff and were so impressed. Having visited many of the great resorts in the area over the last 30 years (The Cloister, Greyfield Inn, etc...), I must say that this hotel is one of the most beautiful and unique along the Southern coast. It is absolutely a fresh new take on low-country style and hospitality. Every direction is a postcard perfect vista of moss draped oaks and whitewashed cottages, while the service and accomodations are in line with a modern 5-star hotel.

We stayed in one of the "village homes" on the property and loved the spacious new rooms outfitted with oriental rugs and antiques. Both the beds and showers were to-die-for and came with large-sized toiletries in scents inspired by the area. Before arriving I was nervous that the brand-newness of it all would feel a little contrived, but no complaints here. If you are looking for historical significance, Savannah is a short 30 minute ride away.
reviews.title: Worth very cent!

reviews.text: The infinity lap pool overlooking the marsh was especially nice with plush lounge chairs and attendants coming by with towels and ice water. Unfortunately we did not have a chance to visit the spa, but the fitness facilities and walking trails were wonderful.
reviews.title: Loved it!
A must stay in Low Country
reviews.text: Melissa and I were so fortunate to be invited on a trip to Inn at Palmetto Bluff. We arrived on a Wednesday and once we arrived were chauffered to our cottage by golf cart. Immediately we knew this place was special. A beautifully furnished cottage with an abundance of luxury. On the way to our cottage I noted some bikes at other cottages. I mentioned this to our driver and within minutes we had two bicycles to ride and enjoy this low country retreat.

reviews.title: beautiful setting but watch construction
reviews.text: What a place. The spa was fantastic with an attendant who would cater to any whim and service that was second to none.

reviews.title: Wonderful Little Property
reviews.text: The food was exceptional and we highly recommend the kayaking. The golf course looked appealing as well. The fitness room was decently equipped and a swim in the pool overlooking May River is a must.

reviews.title: Watch out for construction......
reviews.text: Check out the Art Gallery. Some decent works with a definite southern appeal.

reviews.title: You won't find a better resort...anywhere
reviews.text: I stayed in a "Village Home" at Palmetto Bluff for 3 nights with my husband and 2 children (aged 11 and 15) in mid-April. We travel alot to some of the top properties around and trust me, this property is beautiful.... the Inn, the little village and the cottages associated with the Inn are lovely. Our brand new "Village Home" was also adorable...clean and very comfortable with cozy beds, beautiful linens, comfortable pillows, a stocked frig as well as 4 flat screened TV's. If there is anything to complain about in regards to this home, it is the fact there are NO screens on the windows or doors, so you can not open them. Imagine having beautiful weather right outside your door and you can't enjoy it! A crime! And, as with all new construction, our house was not particularly soundproof, so once one person was up in the morning, we were all up. Lastly, these "Village Homes" are very, very close to one another, so be prepared for no real privacy.

aka: Inn At Palmetto Bluff, An Auberge Hotel Bluffton
description: The Inn at Palmetto Bluff a prestigious luxury inn with gracious South Carolina cottages and village homes located along the May River and a short drive to Savannah - 50 beautifully appointed cottages and cottage suites- South Carolina luxury vacation two, three and four bedroom home rentals - Auberge Spa at Palmetto Bluff is one of the top-rated spas in the United States - 5 locally renowned restaurants for an exquisite dining experience or a casual snack- 2 exclusive pools - Extensive activities offering including: equestrian, boat rides, kayaking and more- 18-hole Jack Nicklaus Signature golf course- 2 private fitness centers, a movement studio and tennis courts- 8 stunning and intimate locations for weddings and events
